comments.body: Hmm wondering about this as well. I imagine this is something like the `nan` string or actual NA value rep when doing `astype(str)`. I wonder if something like that should be held off until a major release. Or do you have another idea in mind?

This is the judgement piece that's so hard :) Some examples may be helpful here.

The astype(str) you bring up is a good example. It's pretty clearly a bug, but it's potentially an extremely disrupting change. However, I think in this case we're covered by the "provide a deprecation path if possible" clause. IIRC we're going to do a `skipna` deprecation.

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/28052 (`DataFrame.to_string` truncating based on display options) is a decent example of a bug fix that's changing behavior. So I think we'd be OK merging that in a minor release (but maybe not a patch release).
